message.content:
Venmo is a mobile payment service owned by PayPal that allows users to send and receive money instantly through the app. Venmo works as a digital wallet, enabling users to transfer funds between friends or pay for goods and services at participating merchants. 

To use Venmo, you must first download the app on your smartphone (available for iOS and Android) and create an account by providing basic information such as name, email address, phone number, bank account or debit/credit card information. Once your account is created, you can link it to your contacts or search for friends using their usernames.

To send money through Venmo:

1. Open the app on your smartphone.
2. Sign in with your username/email address and password.
3.Search for the person you want to send money to in-app search box if they are not already linked.
4.Enter the payment amount.
5.Select whether this transaction will be public(visible),friends-only(payment history visible only among mutual connections of sender/receiver)or private(no visibility/views).
6.Include an optional note describing what this payment is about(eg:"Dinner", "Rent," etc.) also consideremojis relatable within reason but clearly explain occurence .
7.Confirm(internal security procedures may require authorisation beyond initial setup,PIN/password/multi-factor authentication might be needed)
After sending,the recipient'll see the transaction related items :amount,date+time received,payment description(viewer access-level depending).The will have been debited by that figure from sender's connected financial institution while recipients would have credit balance pending receival("Cash Out").
